data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Inspiration exists, but it has to find us working.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Success is dangerous. One begins to copy oneself, and to copy oneself is more dangerous than to copy others. It leads to sterility.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: I am always doing that which I cannot do, in order that I may learn how to do it.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Who sees the human face correctly: the photographer, the mirror, or the painter?

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Everything is a miracle. It is a miracle that one does not dissolve in one's bath like a lump of sugar.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: If all the ways I have been along were marked on a map and joined up with a line, it might represent a minotaur.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: It takes a long time to become young.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Action is the foundational key to all success.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: When I was a child, my mother said to me, 'If you become a soldier, you'll be a general. If you become a monk, you'll end up as the Pope.' Instead, I became a painter and wound up as Picasso.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: We all know that Art is not truth. Art is a lie that makes us realize the truth, at least the truth that is given to us to understand.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Why do two colors, put one next to the other, sing? Can one really explain this? no. Just as one can never learn how to paint.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: All children are artists. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Youth has no age.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Only put off until tomorrow what you are willing to die having left undone.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Everything you can imagine is real.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: The artist is a receptacle for emotions that come from all over the place: from the sky, from the earth, from a scrap of paper, from a passing shape, from a spider's web.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Every positive value has its price in negative terms... the genius of Einstein leads to Hiroshima.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: I have a horror of people who speak about the beautiful. What is the beautiful? One must speak of problems in painting!

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Never permit a dichotomy to rule your life, a dichotomy in which you hate what you do so you can have pleasure in your spare time. Look for a situation in which your work will give you as much happiness as your spare time.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: It is your work in life that is the ultimate seduction.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Sculpture is the art of the intelligence.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: What might be taken for a precocious genius is the genius of childhood. When the child grows up, it disappears without a trace. It may happen that this boy will become a real painter some day, or even a great painter. But then he will have to begin everything again, from zero.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: If only we could pull out our brain and use only our eyes.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: God is really only another artist. He invented the giraffe, the elephant and the cat. He has no real style, He just goes on trying other things.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: The chief enemy of creativity is 'good' sense.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once we grow up.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Art is the elimination of the unnecessary.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: When you start with a portrait and search for a pure form, a clear volume, through successive eliminations, you arrive inevitably at the egg. Likewise, starting with the egg and following the same process in reverse, one finishes with the portrait.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: One does a whole painting for one peach and people think just the opposite - that particular peach is but a detail.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: To copy others is necessary, but to copy oneself is pathetic.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Work is a necessity for man. Man invented the alarm clock.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Some painters transform the sun into a yellow spot, others transform a yellow spot into the sun.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Is there anything more dangerous than sympathetic understanding?

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Our goals can only be reached through a vehicle of a plan, in which we must fervently believe, and upon which we must vigorously act. There is no other route to success.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: The purpose of art is washing the dust of daily life off our souls.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: I paint objects as I think them, not as I see them.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: I do not seek. I find.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Sculpture is the best comment that a painter can make on painting.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: There are only two types of women - goddesses and doormats.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: You have to have an idea of what you are going to do, but it should be a vague idea.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: I'd like to live as a poor man with lots of money.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: I don't believe in accidents. There are only encounters in history. There are no accidents.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Art is a lie that makes us realize truth.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: An idea is a point of departure and no more. As soon as you elaborate it, it becomes transformed by thought.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Good artists copy, great artists steal.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: The older you get the stronger the wind gets - and it's always in your face.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Every act of creation is first an act of destruction.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: One must act in painting as in life, directly.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: The people who make art their business are mostly imposters.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: He can who thinks he can, and he can't who thinks he can't. This is an inexorable, indisputable law.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: My mother said to me, 'If you are a soldier, you will become a general. If you are a monk, you will become the Pope.' Instead, I was a painter, and became Picasso.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: If there were only one truth, you couldn't paint a hundred canvases on the same theme.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: When I die, it will be a shipwreck, and as when a huge ship sinks, many people all around will be sucked down with it.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Art is the lie that enables us to realize the truth.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: What is a face, really? Its own photo? Its make-up? Or is it a face as painted by such or such painter? That which is in front? Inside? Behind? And the rest? Doesn't everyone look at himself in his own particular way? Deformations simply do not exist.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: We don't grow older, we grow riper.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: We must not discriminate between things. Where things are concerned there are no class distinctions. We must pick out what is good for us where we can find it.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: I begin with an idea and then it becomes something else.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: The more technique you have, the less you have to worry about it. The more technique there is, the less there is.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Painting is a blind man's profession. He paints not what he sees, but what he feels, what he tells himself about what he has seen.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Are we to paint what's on the face, what's inside the face, or what's behind it?

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: The world today doesn't make sense, so why should I paint pictures that do?

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: To make oneself hated is more difficult than to make oneself loved.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Computers are useless. They can only give you answers.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: It took me four years to paint like Raphael, but a lifetime to paint like a child.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Art is not the application of a canon of beauty but what the instinct and the brain can conceive beyond any canon. When we love a woman we don't start measuring her limbs.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Colors, like features, follow the changes of the emotions.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: To draw you must close your eyes and sing.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: To finish a work? To finish a picture? What nonsense! To finish it means to be through with it, to kill it, to rid it of its soul, to give it its final blow the coup de grace for the painter as well as for the picture.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Give me a museum and I'll fill it.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: You mustn't always believe what I say. Questions tempt you to tell lies, particularly when there is no answer.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Love is the greatest refreshment in life.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Disciples be damned. It's not interesting. It's only the masters that matter. Those who create.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: The genius of Einstein leads to Hiroshima.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: They ought to put out the eyes of painters as they do goldfinches in order that they can sing better.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: There is no abstract art. You must always start with something. Afterward you can remove all traces of reality.

data.author: Pablo Picasso
data.en: Painting is just another way of keeping a diary.
